title: LIFE Magazine nameplate
content:
This is probably type 101 knowledge, but anyone know the "LIFE" magazine masthead font?  
Here's a link to an old cover  
 [http://image.pathfinder.com/Life/covers/1960/cv102460.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150315170156/http:/image.pathfinder.com/Life/covers/1960/cv102460.jpg "http://image.pathfinder.com/Life/covers/1960/cv102460.jpg")
author: xebede

comments.content: Could easily be custom, but [20th Century](http://web.archive.org/web/20150315170156/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=M.6051.0.4&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=LIFE&sampleSize=96) is close, despite the E's longer bottom stroke.

On just the word LIFE, the closest match is Pakenham Bold Cond  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/typodermic/pakenham-boss/cnd-bold/testdrive...](http://web.archive.org/web/20150315170156/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typodermic/pakenham-boss/cnd-bold/testdrive.html "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/typodermic/pakenham-boss/cnd-bold/testdrive.html")

but that's not going to give you the whole alphabet you want I bet.

Railroad Gothic isn't bad either  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/railroad-gothic/railroadgothic/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150315170156/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/railroad-gothic/railroadgothic/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/railroad-gothic/railroadgothic/")

Interstate gives you the shorter cross bar (not sure that's the term) on the E and F
